verses.verse: And it came to pass<WH6256>, at the time of the return<WH8666> of the year<WH8141>, at the time<WH6256> when kings<WH4428> go out<WH3318> to battle<WH3097>, that Joab led forth<WH5090> the<WH2428> army<WH6635>, and wasted<WH7843> the country<WH776> of the children<WH1121> of Ammon<WH5983>, and came<WH935> and besieged<WH6696> Rabbah<WH7237>. But David<WH1732> tarried<WH3427> at Jerusalem<WH3389>. And Joab<WH3097> smote<WH5221> Rabbah<WH7237>, and overthrew it<WH2040>.

And David<WH1732> took<WH3947> the crown<WH5850> of their king<WH4428> from off his head<WH7218>, and found<WH4672> it to weigh<WH4948> a talent<WH3603> of gold<WH2091>, and there were precious<WH3368> stones<WH68> in it<WH1732>; and it was set upon David's head<WH7218>: and he brought<WH3318> forth the spoil<WH7998> of the city<WH5892>, exceeding<WH3966> much<WH7235>.

And he brought forth<WH3318> the people<WH5971> that were therein<WH7787>, and cut them with saws<WH4050>, and with harrows<WH2757> of iron<WH1270>, and with axes<WH4050>. And thus did<WH6213> David<WH1732> unto all the cities<WH5892> of the children<WH1121> of Ammon<WH5983>. And David<WH1732> and all the people<WH5971> returned<WH7725> to Jerusalem<WH3389>.

And it came to pass after this<WH310>, that there arose<WH5975> war<WH4421> at Gezer<WH1507> with the Philistines<WH6430>: then<WH227> Sibbecai<WH5444> the Hushathite<WH2843> slew<WH5221> Sippai<WH5598>, of the sons<WH3211> of the giant<WH7497>; and they were subdued<WH3665>.

And there was again war<WH4421> with the Philistines<WH6430>; and Elhanan<WH445> the son<WH1121> of Jair<WH3265> slew<WH5221> Lahmi<WH3902> the brother<WH251> of Goliath<WH1555> the Gittite<WH1663>, the staff<WH6086> of whose spear<WH2595> was like a weaver<WH707>'s beam<WH4500>.

And there was again war<WH4421> at Gath<WH1661>, where was a man<WH376> of great stature<WH4060>, whose fingers<WH676> and toes<WH676> were four<WH702> and twenty<WH6242>, six<WH8337> on each hand<WH8337>, and six on each foot<WH3205>; and he also was born unto the giant<WH7497>.
And when he defied<WH2778> Israel<WH3478>, Jonathan<WH3083> the son<WH1121> of Shimea<WH8092> David<WH1732>'s brother<WH251> slew him<WH5221>.
These <WH411> were born<WH3205> unto the giant<WH7497> in Gath<WH1661>; and they fell<WH5307> by the hand<WH3027> of David<WH1732>, and by the hand<WH3027> of his servants<WH5650>.
